definition: mimosa/sensitive plant (that closes its leaves when touched)
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)

sentences.english: With the Mimosa Large hobo you can switch from a shoulder bag to cross-body in seconds.
sentences.chinese: 随着含羞草大流浪汉可以切换横身在几秒钟内从肩袋。

sentences.english: The air was filled with the sweetness of mimosa.
sentences.chinese: 空气中弥漫着含羞草的芬芳。

sentences.english: " I then also small, do not know what "mimosa.
sentences.chinese: 因为我那时候还小，不懂得什么叫“含羞草”。

sentences.english: The Sensitive Plant was the earliest.
sentences.chinese: 这敏感的含羞草出现得最早。

sentences.english: Optimum temperature of seed germination for Mimosa pudica was 30℃.
sentences.chinese: 含羞草种子萌发最适温度为30℃。

sentences.english: A mimosa's leaves are sensitive to touch.
sentences.chinese: 含羞草的叶子对触摸很敏感。

sentences.english: But the Sensitive Plant which could give small fruit.
sentences.chinese: 但这含羞草竟愿把小小的果实贡献出来。

sentences.english: A sensitive plant in a garden grew.
sentences.chinese: 一棵含羞草在花园里生长。

sentences.english: I bought a home a beautiful bowl of mimosa.
sentences.chinese: 回家时我买了一盆漂亮的含羞草。

sentences.english: Guests will toast the royal couple with sparkling mimosas.
sentences.chinese: 来宾们将手举含羞草香槟为这对新人干杯。

sentences.english: Flick the leaf of a mimosa tree or gently heat it and watch it close up.
sentences.chinese: 轻拂含羞草的叶子或少许加热看它慢慢闭合。

sentences.english: I kind of a basin of mimosa.

sentences.chinese: 这就是含羞草“害羞”的原因。

definition: balsam/Balsaminaceae (a flower family including Impatiens balsamina)/touch-me-not/busy Lizzie
